hypothesis_content.title: BTC/ETH Ratio Momentum Reversal After S&P Crypto Index Announcement
hypothesis_content.statement: Following the S&P multi-asset crypto index announcement, the BTC/ETH ratio will experience a short-term reversal when it deviates >2.5% from its 20-day moving average during NEUTRAL regimes, as capital rebalancing flows create mean-reverting pressure.
hypothesis_content.rationale: S&P's entry creates institutional rebalancing flows. During neutral regimes, large deviations in the BTC/ETH ratio tend to revert as market makers arbitrage the spread. The news catalyst provides additional momentum for reversal.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH ratio crosses outside ±2.5% band around its 20-day SMA
S&P crypto index news occurred within previous 3 trading days
BTC 20-day realized volatility < 60% (to filter stress periods)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Ratio returns to within ±0.5% of 20-day SMA
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Ratio continues moving 1.5% beyond entry deviation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Ratio continues trending beyond entry deviation for >3 consecutive days with increasing volume, indicating structural shift rather than temporary dislocation.
